text: The St. Nicholas Cathedral Cathedral of St. Nicholas in Ruski Krstur () also called Ruski Krstur Cathedral is the name given to a religious building affiliated with the Catholic Church which is located in the town of Ruski Krstur, in the city of Kula, in the European country of Serbia. The church follows the Byzantine or Croatian rite and serves as the cathedral of the Apostolic exarchate of Serbia (Exarchatus Apostolicus Serbiae or Гркокатолички апостолски егзархат у Србији). The church was elevated in Cathedral in August 28, 2003, simultaneously with the creation of the Apostolic Exarchate for Catholics of Byzantine rite of Serbia under the pontificate of Pope John Paul II. The present building was built in 1784 but underwent a reconstruction in 1836, as evidenced by the inscription on the north portal. Between 1961-1963 there was the complete restoration of the iconostasis. Some restoration works were carried out in 1972. ==See also== *Roman Catholicism in Serbia Internal view ==References== Category:Eastern Catholic cathedrals in Serbia Category:Ruski Krstur Category:Roman Catholic churches completed in 1784 Category:Cultural Monuments of Great Importance (Serbia)
